abstract: America's largest banks and investment firms have twice gained passage of bills in past month to loosen regulations meant to help reduce risk of another financial crisis, aiming at arcane provisions and employing flurries of lobbying; House approves measure to further defang 2010 Dodd-Frank law by placing more limits on regulators.
lead_paragraph: The continuing assault on the 2010 Dodd-Frank law has achieved remarkable success, especially compared with the repeated failures of opponents of another 2010 law, the Affordable Care Act.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and ERIC LIPTON

snippet: The continuing assault on the 2010 Dodd-Frank law has achieved remarkable success, especially compared with the repeated failures of opponents of another 2010 law, the Affordable Care Act.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: In New Congress, Wall St. Pushes to Undermine Dodd-Frank Reform
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Chips Away at Dodd-Frank Rules
